reviews.review_msg: Dr. Kitchen was an absolutely amazing prof. I took many of his classes and always looked forward to his lectures and tutorials. Great stuff.

I took several courses from Dr.. Kitchen while doing my history degree. It was a pleasure to learn from such an accomplished and passionate historian.  He always was most helpful when I had questions and was generous with his time.
Horrible professor.  Would cancel class to do research for his next book.  Would only use his text in class - money grab.  Knew material but didn't know how to teach.

Excellent prof. I took several European history and WW2 courses from him. Dr. Kitchen captivated me with his vast experience and insightful stories. He made it exciting to come to class. I am dissapointed that he will not be teaching this semester.
Kept cancelling classes to travel to Europe.  Very arrogant.  Stay away if you can.
Amazing, best professor I have ever had. He is intelligence and writes amazing works of history.Wish we had more like him.....
He is the best professor I have ever had!

Whoa guys, cool it! I had him a while ago, maybe he's gotten old, but I don't remember him as bad at all. Actually reminded me of Indiana Jones's English sidesick going off on int'l expeditions on the weekends. Seemed knowledgeable enough

Arrogant piece of work. He lost part of my midterm (10 % of my entire grade) blamed it on me (accusing me of cheating) then left the country.  I got 0 for 10% of my final grade.  To boot, the history dpmt stood beside this fine specimen of an intellect.
Man appears to be senile. Talks about irrelevant things, drifts in and out of material and leaves you hanging. Will often ignore you if he does not like your questions.
A major disappointment.  Totaly unhelpful and out of touch.
